page.title: 05FARMING
page.content: There used to be many{small crofts with a family having a small amount of land around the croft house on which to graze a few animals and raise some food crops. It was subsistence farming. To-day almost all of the small crofts have been made into bigger farms, with larger flocks of sheep and some cattle. The lambs are born in spring time, brought on, and then taken to market (usually in Wick) to be sold to farmers in the south. There they are fattened up ready for slaughtering for meat. It is similar for the cattle. The fields which grow crops mostly grow winter feeds for the animals. Much of the grass is put down for sillage.
